Version control, Git and Git hub

projects.name: Quality-Conform
projects.describe: Another learning project working on gathering of data from forms and processing them. This one registers non-conformities added by users.

projects.name: Soft Table
projects.tech: Technologies used: html5, Tailwind, React, Axios
projects.describe: Quick project for shows, it displays a bit of Tailwind for what is a basic trial. It is a sleeper project now.

projects.name: Flashcards API
projects.describe: The backend side of this project, storing the contents of cards.

projects.name: Flashcards
projects.tech: Technologies used: html5, css3, React, Sass
projects.describe: This is, basically, a tool for memorizing study contents by means of a card game. It is similar to Anki and equivalents.

projects.name: This website
projects.tech: Technologies used: html5, css3, React, Framer-Motion, TypeScript
projects.describe: This is the github link to the code of this website. It was/is developed entirely in React, with animations in Framer-Motion but had many previous incarnations in: Django, Node, PHP/Wordpress and in plain JS

projects.name: Diary App
projects.tech: Technologies used: html5, css3, JS, MeteorJS.
projects.describe: This is a project from my course on Meteor.JS by the University of London - Goldsmiths. This is a diary that keeps track of your entries and returns them to you if you ask for a list of entries. It has a log in page and you must log in if you want to use it. The front and back end are made with Meteor. On clicking, the link will take to the actual app that is active on Heroku.

projects.name: Typer
projects.tech: Technologies used: html5, css3, ES6, jquery, Ajax.
projects.describe: This is project for a Typer game, where it shows you a text and you have to type it as fast as you can. It uses material design for simplification of the UI. The link will take you to the Github page where the project is stored. Follow the readme.md for instructions on how to turn it on locally.

projects.name: Older personal webpages
projects.tech: Technologies used: Python, Django, Wordpress, PHP
projects.describe: Through the years I have made different versions of my personal webpage, as well as other projects. Initially on wordpress in a self-hosted version. Then, tweaking themes using php and making my only branches of themes with personal styles. This is the last version of a personal website, done initially in PHP, then developed with Django - apart from the usual html,css, js, of course. There is no link to this, since most of these pages don't exist anymore.

projects.name: Python Game
projects.describe: Through the years I made several projects in Python as part of my learning path.This is project for a small race game. It was made entirely in Python. This will take you to the github page where the code is backed up. I haven't updated this in several years, so can't say if it still works. But it's symbolic for, literally, hundreds of other small programs and projects that are a key element in my learning path.

aboutMe.paragraph: I am a full-stack developer with more than 7 years developing ðŸ’» websites with modern platforms and programming languages. I like to learn things, build things, fix things ðŸ”§ with a keen eye to design and purpose.

Going into Development was, in a sense, a career change, because that was not my full time job, but, at the same time, building things with code has been a constant throughout my life. From that perspective, I just decided to finally do something I really enjoy and something I am passionate about.
